background.$description: Use as the primary background for the UI.

subtle.$description: Use for a subtle, neutral background that accentuates overlaid surfaces.

inverse.$description: Use for a background color that's the opposite lightness of `color.background`.

border.$description: Use for the border of generic elements.

subtle.$description: Use for the border of generic elements with less emphasis.

subtlest.$description: Use for the border of generic elements with the least emphasis.

disabled.$description: Use for the border of elements in an disabled state.

inverse.$description: Use for the border elements with opposite lightness of `color.border`.

positive.$description: Use for the border of elements that communicate a favorable outcome.

warning.$description: Use for the border of elements that communicate a favorable outcome.

negative.$description: Use for the border of elements that indicate danger or error state.

info.$description: Use for the border of elements that communicate information.

brand.$description: Use for the border of elements that reinforce your brand.

edited.$description: Use for the border of elements in an edited state.

activated.$description: Use for the border of elements in an activated state.

hovered.$description: Use for elevated UIs such as cards, modals or dropdown menus with a hovered state.

focused.$description: Use for elevated UI containers in a focused state.

pressed.$description: Use for elevated UIs such as cards, modals or dropdown menus with a pressed state.

overlay.$description: Use for the background color of overlays such as Modal, Bottom Sheet and Panel.

subtle.$description: Use for elevated UI containers with less emphasis.

hovered.$description: Use for elevated UI containers with less emphasis with a hovered state.

focused.$description: Use for elevated UI containers with less emphasis with a focused state.

pressed.$description: Use for elevated UIs such as cards, modals or dropdown menus with a pressed state.

activated.$description: Use for elevated UI containers in an activated state.

hovered.$description: Use for elevated UI containers in an activated and hovered state.

focused.$description: Use for elevated UI containers in an activated and focused state.

pressed.$description: Use for elevated UI containers in an activated and pressed state.

brand.$description: Use for elevated UI containers with a branded background color.

surface.$description: Use for elevated UIs such as cards, modals or dropdown menus.

subtle.$description: Use for navigation and form field labels.

subtlest.$description: Use for secondary text such as supplementary helper text on an element.

disabled.$description: Use for text that indicates a disabled state.

onFill.$description: Use for text on generic elements.

positive.$description: Use for text on elements that communicate a favorable outcome.

subtle.$description: Use for text on elements that communicate a favorable outcome but with less emphasis.

negative.$description: Use for text on elements that indicate danger or error state.

subtle.$description: Use for text on elements that indicate danger or error state but with less emphasis.

warning.$description: Use for text on elements that emphasize caution.

subtle.$description: Use for text on elements that emphasize caution but with less emphasis.

info.$description: Use for text on elements that communicate information.

subtle.$description: Use for text on elements that communicate information but with less emphasis.

edited.$description: Use for text on elements in an edited state.

subtle.$description: Use for text on elements in an edited state but with less emphasis.

inverse.$description: Use for text on elements with inverse fill.

transparent.$description: Use for text on elements with transparent fill.

disabled.$description: Use for text on generic elements in disabled state.

activated.$description: Use for text on elements in an activated state.

subtle.$description: Use for text on elements in an activated state but with less emphasis.

disabled.$description: Use for text on elements in an activated state but with less emphasis in a disabled state.
Use for text on elements in an activated state in a disabled state.

brand.$description: Use for text on elements with branded fill.

subtle.$description: Use for text on elements with subtle branded fill.

bold.$description: Use for text on elements with branded fill but with more emphasis.

blue.$description: Use for text on elements with a blue accent.

subtle.$description: Use for text on elements with a blue accent but with less emphasis.

yellow.$description: Use for text on elements with a yellow accent.
